subject: Art
title: Limited Palette Mixing
description: Creating rich artwork from only three or four colors plus white.

hook.text: Anders Zorn painted luminous portraits using just four colors: yellow ochre, cadmium red, ivory black, and titanium white. Four tubes. Infinite subtlety. How?

buildup.text: The Zorn palette works because: yellow ochre + white = warm skin highlights. Red + ochre = warm flesh tones. Black + white = cool grays and blues. All mixed colors share pigments, creating automatic harmony.

discovery.text: Ivory black is actually a very dark blue. Mixed with yellow ochre, it creates green. So the Zorn palette secretly has warm and cool primaries â€” it's more versatile than it appears.

twist.text: Limiting your palette eliminates one of art's biggest enemies: choice paralysis. With 50 colors, every decision is overwhelming. With 4 colors, every decision is manageable.

climax.text: Try the Zorn palette challenge: paint a portrait or still life using only yellow ochre, cadmium red, ivory black, and white. You'll be amazed at the range you can achieve.

punchline.text: Four colors. Full range. The limitation IS the secret ingredient.

quiz.question: What four colors make up the Zorn palette?
options: Yellow ochre, cadmium red, ivory black, titanium white
